include/w5300.h File Reference

Detailed Description

Definition register of W5300 and basic I/O functions.

This file defines the memory map and values of W5300 register.
Also, it defines the basic I/O function to access register of W5300.

Author:
MidnightCow
Date:
08/08/2008
Version:
1.2.0
Revision History :
Date Version Author Description
24/03/2008 1.0.0 MidnightCow Release with W5300 launching
01/05/2008 1.0.1 MidnightCow Refer to M_01052008.
Modify a logical error in iinchip_irq().
15/05/2008 1.1.0 MidnightCow Refer to M_15052008.
Delete 'getSn_DPORTR()' because Sn_DPORTR is write-only register.
Replace Sn_DHAR2 with Sn_DIPR2 in getSn_DIPR().
08/08/2008 1.2.0 MidnightCow - Refer to M_08082008.
  Add IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER() & IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT() to wiz_read_buf() and wiz_write_buf().
- Add the description to Sn_PROTOR with IPPROTO_XXX definition.
- Modify the description of Sn_SSR and close().

Definition in file w5300.h.

#include "iinchip_conf.h"
#include "types.h"

#define SOCK_CLOSED   0x00
 It is the status that resource of SOCKETn is released.
#define SOCK_ARP   0x01
 It is the status that ARP-request is transmitted in order to acquire destination hardware address.
#define SOCK_INIT   0x13
 It is the status that SOCKETn is open as TCP mode.
#define SOCK_LISTEN   0x14
 It is the status that SOCKETn operates as "TCP SERVER" and waits for connection-request (SYN packet) from "TCP CLIENT".
#define SOCK_SYNSENT   0x15
 It is the status that connect-request(SYN packet) is transmitted to "TCP SERVER".
#define SOCK_SYNRECV   0x16
 It is the status that connect-request(SYN packet) is received from "TCP CLIENT".
#define SOCK_ESTABLISHED   0x17
 It is the status that TCP connection is established.
#define SOCK_FIN_WAIT   0x18
 It is the status that SOCKETn is closed.
#define SOCK_CLOSING   0x1A
 It is the status that SOCKETn is closed.
#define SOCK_TIME_WAIT   0x1B
 It is the status that SOCKETn is closed.
#define SOCK_CLOSE_WAIT   0x1C
 It is the status that disconnect-request(FIN packet) is received from the peer.
#define SOCK_LAST_ACK   0x1D
 It is the status that SOCKETn is closed.
#define SOCK_UDP   0x22
 It is the status that SOCKETn is open as UDP mode.
#define SOCK_IPRAW   0x32
 It is the status that SOCKETn is open as IPRAW mode.
#define SOCK_MACRAW   0x42
 It is the status that SOCKET0 is open as MACRAW mode.
#define SOCK_PPPoE   0x5F
 It is the status that SOCKET0 is open as PPPoE mode.

Definition at line 1759 of file w5300.h.

#define IR_DPUR   (1 << 6)

Destination port unreachable bit of IR.

It's set as '1' when receiving ICMP(destination port unreachable) packet.

See also:
UIPR, UPORTR

Definition at line 1134 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by iinchip_irq().

#define IR_FMTU   (1 << 4)

Fragment MTU bit of IR.

When receiving ICMP (Fragment MTU) packet, it's set as '1'.

See also:
FMTUR

Definition at line 1147 of file w5300.h.

#define IR_IPCF   (1 << 7)

IP conflict bit of IR.

It's set as '1' when receiving ARP-request packet having same IP address as SIPR of W5300.

Definition at line 1127 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by iinchip_irq().

#define IR_PPPT   (1 << 5)

PPPoE terminate bit of IR.

When the connection with server is closed at the PPPoE mode, it is set as '1'.

Definition at line 1140 of file w5300.h.

#define IR_SnINT ( n   )     (0x01 << n)

SOCKETn interrupt occurrence bit of IR.

When an interrupt occurs at the SOCKETn, it becomes '1'. This interrupt information is applied to Sn_IR's LSB.
This Bit is automatically cleared when Sn_IR's LSB is cleared to 0x00 by Host.

See also:
Sn_IR

Definition at line 1155 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by iinchip_irq().

#define MR_DBS   (1 << 2)

Data bus swap of MR.

0 : Diable swap
1 : Enable swap

This bit swaps MSB and LSB of all registers including Sn_TX_FIFOR/ Sn_RX_FIFOR.

Note:
This bit can be applied when MR_DBW is '1' .

Definition at line 1106 of file w5300.h.

#define MR_DBW   (1 << 15)

Data bus width bit of MR.

0 : 8 bit
1 : 16 bit

Read only. When reset of W5300, it is fixed according to logic level of PIN 'BIT16EN'.

Definition at line 1024 of file w5300.h.

#define MR_FS   (1 << 8)

FIFO swap bit of MR.

0 : Diable swap
1 : Enable swap

It swaps the most significant byte (MSB) and least significant byte (LSB) of Sn_TX_FIFOR & Sn_RX_FIFOR.
Basically, the byte ordering of W5300 is big-endian.

Definition at line 1061 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by pppinit(), recv(), and recvfrom().

#define MR_IND   (1 << 0)

Indirect mode bit of MR.

0 : Direct Address Mode
1 : Indirect Address Mode

It sets host interface mode of W5300.

See also:
__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__

Definition at line 1116 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by iinchip_init().

#define MR_MPF   (1 << 14)

Mac layer pause frame bit of MR.

Read only. It is set as '1', when pause frame is received from router or switch.
When set as '1', all data is paused until changing to '0'.

Definition at line 1032 of file w5300.h.

#define MR_MT   (1 << 5)

Memory test bit of MR.

0 : Disable Internal TX/RX Memory Test
1 : Enable Internal TX/RX Memory Test

For the detail, refer to "How to test internal TX/RX memory.pdf".

Definition at line 1078 of file w5300.h.

#define MR_PB   (1 << 4)

Ping block bit of MR.

0 : Disable ping block
1 : Enable ping block

Definition at line 1086 of file w5300.h.

#define MR_PPPoE   (1 << 3)

PPPoE bit of MR.

0 : Disable PPPoE mode
1 : Enable PPPoE mode

This bit should be set as '1', when connecting to ADSL server with router or others.
For the detail, refer to "How to use PPPoE in W5300.pdf"

Definition at line 1096 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by pppinit(), and pppterm().

#define MR_RDH   (1 << 10)

Read data hold time bit of MR.

0 : No use
1 : Use

When the Host reads, W5300 holds the Read Data during '2' X 'PLL_CLK' after the read operation is finished ('/CS' is de-asserted as High).

#define MR_RST   (1 << 7)

S/W reset bit of MR.

If it's set as '1', W5300 is reset. This Bit is automatically cleared after reset.

#define MR_WDF ( X   )     ((X & 0x07) << 11)

Write data fetch time bit of MR.

When the host writes, since '/CS' is asserted low, W5300 fetches Write Data after 'X' X 'PLL_CLK'.

#define Sn_CR_CLOSE   0x10

CLOSE command value of Sn_CR.

Definition at line 1392 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by close(), pppinit(), and pppterm().

#define Sn_CR_CONNECT   0x04

CONNECT command value of Sn_CR.

It is valid only when Sn_MR(P3:P0) = Sn_MR_TCP and operates SOCKETn as 'TCP-CLIENT'.
It transmits connect-request(SYN packet) to the TCP server designated with Sn_DIPR and Sn_DPORTR.
When connect-request is successfully processed (when receiving SYN/ACK packet), Sn_IR(Sn_IR_CON) becomes '1', and Sn_SSR is changed to SOCK_ESTABLISHED.
There are 3 cases if connect-request is failed.

  • when ARP timeout occurs (Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1') because destination hardware address is not acquired through ARP process
  • when SYN/ACK packet is not received and TCP timout occurrs (Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1').
  • When RST packet is received instead of SYN/ACK packet.

    In above 3 cases, Sn_SSR is changed to SOCK_CLOSED.

Definition at line 1351 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by connect().

#define Sn_CR_DISCON   0x08

DISCONNECT command value of Sn_CR.

It is valid only when Sn_MR(P3:P0) = Sn_MR_TCP and operates SOCKETn as both 'TCP-SERVER' and 'TCP-CLIENT'.
It performs Disconnect-process.

  • Active close : It transmits disconnect-request(FIN packet) to the connected peer.
  • Passive close : When receiving disconnect-request (FIN packet) from the peer, it transmits FIN packet.

    If Disconnect-request is successful (when receiving FIN/ACK packet), Sn_SSR is changed to SOCK_CLOSED. If Disconnect-request is failed, TCP timeout occurs(Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1') and Sn_SSR is changed to SOCK_CLOSED.

Note:
If Sn_CR_CLOSE is used instead of Sn_CR_DISCON, only Sn_SSR is changed to SOCK_CLOSED without disconnect-process (disconnect-request).
If RST packet is received from the peer during communication, Sn_SSR is unconditionally changed to SOCK_CLOSED.

Definition at line 1371 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by disconnect().

#define Sn_CR_LISTEN   0x02

LISTEN command value of Sn_CR.

It is valid only when Sn_MR(P3:P0) = Sn_MR_TCP and operates SOCKETn as 'TCP-SERVER'.
It changes Sn_SSR to SOCK_LISTEN at the SOCK_INIT in order to wait for connect-request (SYN packet) from any 'TCP Clinet'.

When Sn_SSR is SOCK_LISTEN and connect-request from a TCP Client is successfully processed, Sn_IR(Sn_IR_CON) becomes '1' and Sn_SSR is changed to SOCK_ESTABLISHED.
In case that the connect-request is not processed (SYN/ACK transmission is failed), TCP timeout occurs (Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1') and Sn_SSR is changed to SOCK_CLOSED.

Note:
If TCP connect-request port number of TCP Client does not exist, W5300 transmits RST packet and Sn_SSR is not changed.

Definition at line 1332 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by listen().

#define Sn_CR_OPEN   0x01

OPEN command value of Sn_CR.

It initializes SOCKETn and opens according to protocol type set in Sn_MR(P3:P0).
Below is the value change of Sn_SSR according to Sn_MR(P3:P0).

  • Sn_MR_CLOSE : Not available
  • Sn_MR_TCP : SOCK_INIT
  • Sn_MR_UDP : SOCK_UDP
  • Sn_MR_IPRAW : SOCK_IPRAW
  • Sn_MR_MAC : SOCK_MACRAW
  • Sn_MR_PPPoE : SOCK_PPPoE

#define Sn_CR_RECV   0x40

RECV command value of Sn_CR.

Definition at line 1458 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by pppinit_in(), recv(), and recvfrom().

#define Sn_CR_SEND   0x20

SEND command value of Sn_CR.

It transmits data (DATA packets) as big as the size of Sn_TX_WRSR. In case that Sn_MR(P3:P0) is Sn_MR_TCP or Sn_MR_UDP, if Sn_TX_WRSR of data is bigger than maximum segment size(MSS), W5300 automatically divides data in MSS unit, and transmits the divided data.
In case that Sn_MR(P3:P0) is Sn_MR_IPRAW or Sn_MR_MACRAW, this function is not supported. Host should divide data in MSS unit and transmit the divided data to a peer.

When completing the Sn_CR_SEND process, Sn_IR(Sn_IR_SENDOK) becomes '1'. After checking Sn_IR(Sn_IR_SENDOK) = '1', Host can perform Sn_CR_SEND for the next data transmittion.

If data is successfully transmitted to the peer by Sn_CR_SEND (when DATA/ACK packet is received from the peer), Sn_TX_FSR is increased by the size of transmitted data. If not (when DATA/ACK packet is not received), TCP timeout occurs (Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1') and Sn_SSR is changed to SOCK_CLOSED.

Note:
Host copies TX data into internal TX memory of SOCKETn through Sn_TX_FIFOR before performing Sn_CR_SEND, and configures data size in Sn_TX_WRSR.

Definition at line 1400 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by recv(), send(), and sendto().

#define Sn_CR_SEND_KEEP   0x22

SEND_KEEP command value of Sn_CR.

It is valid only when Sn_MR(P3:P0) = Sn_MR_TCP.
In order to check TCP connection status with the peer, KEEP ALIVE(KA) packet can be transmitted. Sn_CR_SEND_KEEP is available only in case of Sn_KPALVTR = 0, but ignored in case of Sn_KPALVTR > 0.
In case of Sn_KPALVTR > 0, KA packet is automatically transmitted if there is no data communication during the time of Sn_KPALVTR.

If KA packet is successfully transmitted (when KA/ACK packet is received from the peer), Sn_SSR maintains SOCK_ESTABLISHED status. If it is failed to transmit the KA packet (when the peer already closed the connection, or KA/ACK is not transmitted), TCP timeout will occurs(Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1') and Sn_SSR is changed to SOCK_CLOSED.

Note:
KA packet can be transmitted after one or more data communication is processed.

Definition at line 1438 of file w5300.h.

#define Sn_CR_SEND_MAC   0x21

SEND_MAC command value of Sn_CR.

It is valid only in Sn_MR(P3:P0) = Sn_MR_UDP or Sn_MR_IPRAW
The basic operation is same as Sn_CR_SEND.
Sn_CR_SEND needs ARP process that acquires destination hardware address, but Sn_CR_SEND_MAC is no need ARP process and just use the user-specified destination hardware address in Sn_DHAR. Sn_CR_SEND_MAC can reduce network traffic by removing ARP process when sending UDP/IP data to the destination.

Setting for the case that the connection with the peer is successfully established.

#define Sn_MR_ALIGN   (1 << 8)

Alignment bit of Sn_MR.

'0' - No use alignment
'1' - Use alignment

It is only valid on Sn_MR_TCP.
When received data size is of even number and set as '1', data receiving performance can be improved by removing PACKET-INFO(Data Size) that is attached to every receipt data.

#define Sn_MR_CLOSE   0x00

Protocol bits of Sn_MR.

No used.
It configures communication protocol (TCP, UDP, IP RAW, MAC RAW) in each socket

#define Sn_MR_MF   (1 << 6)

MAC filter bit of Sn_MR.

'0' - Disable MAC filter
'1' - Enable MAC filter

It is only valid on Sn_MR_MACRAW.
When this bit is set as '1', W5300 can receive packet that is belong in itself or broadcasting.
When this bit is set as '0', W5300 can receive all packets on ethernet.

Definition at line 1233 of file w5300.h.

#define Sn_MR_MULTI   (1 << 7)

Multicasting bit of Sn_MR.

'0' - Disable multicasting
'1' - Enable multicasting

It is only valid on Sn_MR_UDP.
In order to use multicasting, set its bit, the IP address and port number in Sn_DIPR and Sn_DPORTR respectively before 'Sn_CR = Sn_CR_OPEN'.

Definition at line 1222 of file w5300.h.

#define Sn_MR_ND   (1 << 5)

No delayed ack bit of Sn_MR.

'0' - Disable no delayed ack
'1' - Enable no delayed ack

It is only valid on Sn_MR_TCP.
In case that this Bit is set as '1', ACK packet is transmitted right after receiving data packet from the peer.
This Bit is recommended to be set as '1' for TCP performance improvement. In case that this Bit is set as '0', ACK packet is transmitted after the time set in RTR regardless of Data packet receipt.

PPPoE.

Note:
This mode can be used only in SOCKET0.
S0_MR_PPPoE is temporarily used for PPPoE server connection/termination. After PPPoE session is established, it can be used as another protocol.

Definition at line 1287 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by close(), loopback_udp(), and recvfrom().

#define SOCK_ARP   0x01

It is the status that ARP-request is transmitted in order to acquire destination hardware address.

This status is observed when Sn_CR_SEND is performed at the SOCK_UDP or SOCK_IPRAW, or Sn_CR_CONNECT is performed at the SOCK_INIT.
If hardware address is successfully acquired from destination (when ARP-response is received), it is changed to SOCK_UDP, SOCK_IPRAW or SOCK_SYNSENT.
If it's failed and ARP timeout(Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1') occurs, in case of UDP or IPRAW mode it goes back to the previous status(SOCK_UDP or SOCK_IPRAW), in case of TCP mode it goes to the SOCK_CLOSED.

See also:
Sn_SSR
Note:
ARP-process operates at the SOCK_UDP or SOCK_IPRAW if the current Sn_DIPR is different from the previous Sn_DIPR. If previous and current values of Sn_DIPR are same, ARP-process doesn't operate becase the destination hardware address is already acquired.

Definition at line 1589 of file w5300.h.

#define SOCK_CLOSE_WAIT   0x1C

It is the status that disconnect-request(FIN packet) is received from the peer.

As TCP connection is half-closed, it is possible to transfer data packet. In order to complete the TCP disconnection, Sn_CR_DISCON should be performed.
For SOCKETn close without disconnection-process, Sn_CR_CLOSE can be just performed.

See also:
Sn_SSR

Definition at line 1692 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by loopback_tcpc(), loopback_tcps(), and send().

#define SOCK_CLOSED   0x00

It is the status that resource of SOCKETn is released.

When Sn_CR_DISCON or Sn_CR_CLOSE is performed, or ARP/TCP timout occurs, it is changed to SOCK_CLOSED regardless of the previous Sn_SSR value.

See also:
Sn_SSR

Definition at line 1678 of file w5300.h.

#define SOCK_ESTABLISHED   0x17

It is the status that TCP connection is established.

It is changed to SOCK_ESTABLISHED when SYN packet from "TCP CLIENT" is successfully processed at the SOCK_LISTEN, or Sn_CR_CONNECT is successfully performed. At this status, DATA packet can be transferred, that is, Sn_CR_SEND or Sn_CR_RECV command can be performed.

See also:
Sn_SSR

#define SOCK_FIN_WAIT   0x18

It is the status that SOCKETn is closed.

It is observed in the disconnect-process of active close or passive close.
It is changed to SOCK_CLOSED when disconnect-process is successfully finished or TCP timeout occurs(Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1').

See also:
Sn_SSR

Definition at line 1666 of file w5300.h.

#define SOCK_INIT   0x13

It is the status that SOCKETn is open as TCP mode.

It is changed to SOCK_INIT when Sn_MR(P3:P0) is Sn_MR_TCP and Sn_CR_OPEN is performed. It is the initial step of TCP connection establishment.
It is possible to perform Sn_CR_LISTEN at the "TCP SERVER" mode and Sn_CR_CONNECT command at the "TCP CLIENT".

Sn_SSR

Definition at line 1703 of file w5300.h.

#define SOCK_LISTEN   0x14

It is the status that SOCKETn operates as "TCP SERVER" and waits for connection-request (SYN packet) from "TCP CLIENT".

When Sn_CR_LISTEN is performed, it is changed to SOCK_LISTEN. When connect-request(SYN packet) from "TCP CLIENT" is successfully processed, SOCK_LISTEN is changed to SOCK_ESTABLISHED.
If it is failed, TCP timout occurs(Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1') and changed to SOCK_CLOSED.

See also:
Sn_SSR

#define SOCK_SYNRECV   0x16

It is the status that connect-request(SYN packet) is received from "TCP CLIENT".

It is automatically changed to SOCK_ESTABLISHED when W5300 successfully transmits connect-accept(SYN/ACK packet) to the "TCP CLIENT".
If it is failed, TCP timeout occurs(Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1'), and it is changed to SOCK_CLOSED.

See also:
Sn_SSR

Definition at line 1644 of file w5300.h.

#define SOCK_SYNSENT   0x15

It is the status that connect-request(SYN packet) is transmitted to "TCP SERVER".

This status shows changing process from SOCK_INIT to SOCK_ESTABLISHED by Sn_CR_CONNECT.
At this status, if connect-accept(SYN/ACK packet) is received from "TCP SERVER", it is automatically changed to SOCK_ESTABLISHED. If SYN/ACK packet is not received from the "TCP SERVER" before TCP Timeout occurs (Sn_IR(Sn_IR_TIMEOUT)='1'), it is changed to SOCK_CLOSED.

See also:
Sn_SSR

uint32 getSn_RX_RSR ( SOCKET  s  ) 

It gets Sn_RX_RSR value.

Parameters:
[in] s SOCKET number. It is valid when 0 <= s <= MAX_SOCK_NUM - 1.
Returns:
It returns the byte size of received data in internal RX memory of s-th SOCKET.
Warning:
Warning:
The host can read the wrong value of Sn_RX_RSR.
Because Sn_TX_RSR is not changed by 'system bus signal' but changed by synchronous 'NIC_CLK' clock.
To prevented this problem, the host should read it until the previous value is equal to the curruent.

It gets Sn_TX_FSR value.

Parameters:
[in] s SOCKET number. It is valid when 0 <= s <= MAX_SOCK_NUM - 1.

Warning:

void iinchip_init ( void   ) 

It initializes W5300.

It initializes W5300 by soft reset and decides the host interface mode by configuration MR.

Note:
You can modify this function to configure MR_WDF, MR_RDH, MR_FS, MR_DBS, MR_PB, MR_PPPoE.

uint16 IINCHIP_READ ( uint32  addr  ) 

Basic I/O function.

It reads a value from a register

Parameters:
[in] addr register address
Returns:
the value of register
Note:
If you define __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__, you can use the below code instead of this function for the better performance. 
 #define IINCHIP_READ(uint32 addr) (*(vint16*)addr)

uint8 *  passwd,
uint8  passwdlen 
)

It initializes to PPPoE of W5300.

[in] time The keep alive timer value of s-th SOCKET to be set. The unit is 5 seconds.
Note:
When Sn_KPALVTR > 0, KEEP ALIVE(KA) packet is automatically transmitted and Sn_CR_SEND_KEEP is ignored.
When Sn_KPALVTR = 0, KA packet is manually transmitted by Sn_CR_SEND_KEEP.
See also:
getSn_KPALVTR()

uint8 sysinit ( uint8 *  tx_size,
uint8 *  rx_size 
)

It allocate internal TX/RX memory of each SOCKET.

Parameters:
[in] tx_size The pointer to allocate tx_size[n] to the internal TX memory of each SOCKET.
( 0 <= n <= MAX_SOCK_NUM-1).
TX memory size of each SOCKET is configurable in the range of 0~64Kbytes. Total memory size of each SOCKET's TX memory should be the multiple of 8.
[in] rx_size The pointer to allocate rx_size[n] to the internal RX memory of each SOCKET.
( 0 <= n <= MAX_SOCK_NUM-1).
RX memory size of each SOCKET is configurable in the range of 0~64Kbytes. Total memory size of each SOCKET's TX memory and RX memory should be 128Kbytes.
Returns:
If success, it returns 1. Otherwize 0.

uint32 wiz_read_buf ( SOCKET  s,
uint8 *  buf,
uint32  len 
)

It copies data to your buffer from internal RX memory.

It copies the len bytes of internal RX memory of s-th SOCKET to buf through Sn_RX_FIFOR.

Parameters:
[in] s SOCKET number. It is valid when 0 <= s <= MAX_SOCK_NUM - 1.
[out] buf Destination buffer to copy
The length of buf should be equal or greater than len + 1, in order to prevent the memory violation.
[in] len bytes of internal RX memory of s-th SOCKET to copy.
Returns:
The copied byte number
Note:
In case using interrupt or multi-task, it is protected with IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER() & IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT() while Sn_RX_FIFOR read.
If no use, it can be occured some problem such as invalid PACKET_INFO or DATA.

Referenced by pppinit_in(), recv(), and recvfrom().

uint32 wiz_write_buf ( SOCKET  s,
uint8 *  buf,
uint32  len 
)

It copies data to interna1 TX memory.

It copies the len bytes of buf to internal TX memory of s-th SOCKET through Sn_TX_FIFOR.

Parameters:
[in] s SOCKET number. It is valid when 0 <= s <= MAX_SOCK_NUM - 1.
[in] buf Source buffer to copy from
[in] len bytes of data to copy.
Returns:
The copied byte number
Note:
In case using interrupt or multi-task, it is protected with IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER() & IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT() while Sn_TX_FIFOR write.
If no use, it can be occured some problem such that invalid DATA are transmitted.
